reviews.review:
It will leave you begging for the sweet relief of death as you will spend months in a delirious state of mental darkness and depression, brooding and batteling the thought that Half Life 3 might never actullay come out.
But otherwise it's amazing. 10/10

成就系统本身是带来游戏之外的乐趣，但设置不当就会适得其反。送玩偶进火箭的成就就是后者。如果想要完成这个成就，一路上就像弱智一样。走到哪里带到哪里，开车跟一个神经病一样，要被直升机射死了还在找玩偶，一不留神又被打飞没影。2和第一章的成就还可以，增加了游戏乐趣和一点挑战。但我认为这个成就毁了第二章应有的节奏，让想完成该成就的玩家抓狂。第二章刚发布我就已经打通了，现在想做下成就，但我没完成就删掉游戏了。我不想为了如此脑残的成就而丧失了游戏乐趣。在这里给不推荐是为了提醒下成就的设计者要三思。成就系统应该是魔兽世界先推出的，我也是它的玩家。它里边有高难度的成就，但不会让玩家像一个脑残一样。希望如果有3的话，不要让成就毁了游戏。以上为个人看法。

This game is just fantastic. Valve did a good job especially considering it's been a decade and people still play this. 
10/10

游戏本体质量没话说，但成就系统可以说是整个半条命系列中最蛋疼的一作了，譬如[小小火箭人]和[拿些幼虫]，既难做又没什么乐趣，[小小火箭人]在第四、第五章开车还要兼顾侏儒玩具不掉下去的体验简直可以说屎一样，以及[拿些幼虫]的设计初衷是为了让那些有强迫症并以挤青春痘为乐的玩家怒刷一发存在感吗？可能有人要说了，“没人强迫你做呀！”，对，是没强迫我做，但你承不承认成就系统也是游戏的一部分？如果游戏不是为了乐趣，那你为什么玩游戏？玩得不爽还不让吐槽了？
It seems tedious to write a separate review for this game in addition to Half Life 2. It's the exact same game, just as good.
good game!!!

10/10

Продолжение сюжетной линии Half-Life 2.
Окончательно выбравшись из Сити 17, Гордон Фриман и Аликс Вэнс собираются с силами для пути в Белую Рощу - запасную исследовательскую базу Илая Вэнса, откуда они должны будут отправиться дальше расследовать подробности захвата человечества Альянсом. В пути из ждут долгие переезды, засады с большим количеством Охотников, солдат Альянса и страйдеров.

万万没想到，我在第二章花费的时间比第一章多。
10年前我们为仙剑4而痛哭过，原因各位都懂[spoiler]盗版猖獗[/spoiler]。但是，这一年十月，半条命2：第二章出现了，它仅仅晚仙剑4两个月上市，但画质却更为逼真(以2007年的标准来看)，水面就不说了。（更不用说之后的使命召唤4：现代战争和显卡危机初代了。）
但那时，代理商(神州奥美)要玩完了。于是，当国产武侠游戏出破解就挨喷的时候，很多人却心安理得地玩着第二章的盗版[spoiler]（我没有）[/spoiler]。八年后的2015年，当仙剑6把仙剑送上死亡线的时候（那个令人窒息的公关），我们开始发现——第二章、高恋、符石在Steam上有卖[spoiler]之后Steam开放了人民币结算[/spoiler]。可以说，像高恋和符石这样的游戏在Steam上一抓一大把，可玩性直接秒杀大多数国产武侠单机[spoiler]没错的话，是以凡人修仙传为代表的武侠单机[/spoiler]。扯了那么远，我就说吧，第二章的结局是悲剧性的，却是国产武侠单机很欠缺的。至少，悲剧结局不应该像情怀6那样如此恶俗。[b] 而且，我们应该意识到，国产武侠单机不能代表所有国产单机。[/b]
虽然仙剑系列我没买，然而，我想借半条命2：第二章的评测问问：仙剑7能做出它那样的水平吗？如果不能，公关又重蹈仙六覆辙，那仙剑就只能成为历史了。
2019年的今天，我对仙剑七已经绝望，尽管第二章的制作者做出了A牌这个骂不绝口的雷作......
Alyx dies.

Wow.

This is what gaming is all about. This set the bar for not only gameplay, but storytelling in gameplay (and places the content high on the list of great stories told, period). Episode Two picks up exactly where Episode One leaves off. From the first moment, it's off like a shot and takes the player on an absolutely incredible journey. It is the ultimate meeting of cinema-inspired narrative and video gaming (at least as far as the FPS genre is concerned). The last three chapters of this DLC are three of the best in the HL franchise, possibly in the shooter genre.

10/10. Simply amazing.

Half-Life 2: Episode Two vem para completar essa “trilogia” de Half-Lifes 2 e complementar ainda mais a história da série, com dois novos inimigos o Antlion Worker e o Hunter e com uma nova campanha relativamente grande em comparação com o episódio um, mas ainda sim menor que o jogo original, sem novas armas em relação aos jogos anteriores, mas com uma pequena modificação no gameplay, agora a lanterna gasta uma energia própria ao invés de usar a energia do traje, de resto a jogatina continua simples e intuitiva como sempre, totalmente obrigatório para quem jogou os outros jogos.

I recommend you play this before Half Life 3 comes out. You might also want to play Portal since the plots may be intertwined. It's only a matter of time right?

This is simply the best game of all time. Just finished for the 4th time. Steam, please give us the next half life game. It will be the biggest release in all of gaming history. So even if it is somehow not satisfactory you'll still earn an enormous revenue. So, you've got nothing to lose. 
I can speak only for myself, and all i wanna say is that i don't even care how it will be. I just want some more of half life man, as do all of the fans. 
It is just criminal to end the 2nd episode in the biggest twist in the game and not follow it up. 

Anyway, steam people, if you guys are reading this, i just want to thank all of you for making my life so much better. Please keep making games just like before. Don't change the "single player narrative-driven" approach to games. I think we all need a little bit of old-school hardcore gaming in our lives just like in the earlier steam games.

Thank you, Steam.

La suite directe des évènements tracés dans Half-Life 2 Episode 1, cet Episode 2 a le mérite d'être presque deux fois plus long que le 1. C'est-à-dire, deux fois plus d'aventure et d'action !
Cette fois-ci le jeu se découpe en 9 chapitres, et grande nouveauté (sans pour autant spoiler), la plupart de l'histoire se déroule en plein air, eh oui, fini la ville et les batailles rebelles VS Cartel ! Alors si vous voulez une bouffée d'air frais et de forêt (ou de souterrain :p) foncez dessus !

Un bon conseil cependant : si vous voulez vous essayer à Half-Life 2, jouez vraiment au 1 avant. Puis aussi à Opposing Force et Blue Shift (qui décrivent les évènements du 1 avec un autre point de vue). Ainsi, vous serez moins largués dans le 2 et ses Episodes, et pourrez profiter pleinement de l'histoire et de l'aventure.

Je recommande très, très vivement la série entière !

This game, and its entire series, were quite possibly one of the best I've ever played (including the expansions). The tidbits of humor here and there got me giggling constantly, the attention to detail, the storyline, everything. I cant wait for the next installment!

Half-Life 2 was an amazing game and still one of our favorites ever made on the PC. Episode One wasn't as sweet, but still had some wonderful moments and helped develop Alyx Vance further as a character and tie her even more into the storyline. The newest, Episode Two, combines the excitement, variety, and spectacular level design of the original with the character and story development of Episode One creating an amazing package that anybody who played Half-Life 2 should gobble up as soon as possible whether that be alone or in the Orange Box.

The story finds Gordon Freeman, the silent but deadly scientist from Black Mesa, and Alyx Vance, the ever capable and crafty daughter of old friend Eli Vance, on the outskirts of City 17 and looking to make their way to resistance headquarters to deliver information vital to the cause.

While there's still a strong amount of environmental storytelling, you'll hear a lot more conversations from a lot of different sources explaining the events in more detail. This helps fill out the events happening around you and has the added benefit of helping give the secondary characters more depth. Alyx, Eli, Dr. Kleiner, and the return of the blowhard Magnusson fill out a terrific cast that continues to grow in size and depth of personality. The voice actors lend their gusto along with improved facial animation to insert a range of emotion that's basically unmatched in games. Add in the character models and body animation that also improve and you've got yourself a cast of characters that really come alive and that you begin to actually care about. Even the Vortigaunts (who now fit better into the visuals with awesome new models and textures) have an increased level of importance and personality.

Another returning favorite character, one you may be able to guess, drops another puzzle in our laps about past events and hints at true histories of certain characters. The sequence is inserted in such a perfect way that makes you feel angered, intrigued, and vaguely helpless towards a future you don't fully understand. This moment along with the awesome introduction to the Advisors and a couple others help set up the story for the future. The fact that the ending is exciting and moving only helps complete the package. The only negative side-effect of this all is that I really, really want to play the next episode so that I can find out what's going on and see how much farther Portal ties in to the whole thing.

Half-Life 2 was special for a lot of reasons, but one of the biggest was the diversity of the levels and how there was never, ever a dull moment. One moment you'd be fighting Combine through the sewers and the next speeding across the beach in a buggy and all the while entering very distinct environments to fight different kinds and different combinations of enemies. Episode Two continues in that tradition by including creepy (and sometimes disgusting) claustrophobic tunnels filled with antlions, expansive outdoor areas and smaller buildings with the new Hunters, large abandoned structures filled with zombies and Combine, and one spectacular final battle which you have to participate in to really appreciate. There really is never a moment where you're going to feel let down or bored. If there's not a fight going on, there's some story happening and conversations to pay attention to. If neither of those things is happening, there's some scene in the distance or background that begs attention. And most of the time, no matter how many conversations you seem to be having, you're probably not but a couple of seconds from the next big battle. 

Episode Two is a cornucopia of gaming fun and brings back old favorites and new instant classics. One of the special weapon devices you use towards the end of the game will undoubtedly be coming back for more and I can only hope to see the awesome cage car again though that's less likely. You'll find nothing but familiar weapons in the catalog of damage dealing devices though you will find a couple of new enemies to give you some trouble. There's a new antlion that spits poison at you but the big addition is, without a doubt, the Combine Hunter. These guys are scary. They're happy enough to run you down or shoot you from afar but either way they do a lot of damage and aren't easy to bring down with conventional weapons. Whatever way you take care of them, you'll have fun doing it. Visually these guys are really impressively designed. They're sleek and powerful all at once and reek of malicious alien intelligence.

We also see the return of sidekicks that come with you into battle. Valve has definitely learned some lessons from previous games. The friendly AI not only is useful to have around while managing not to steal your thunder, but also no longer gets in your way and never gets stuck. Whether it's because the pathfinding has been improved or they just decided not to have AI tag along when you're fighting in really cramped spaces, it works. You still get the thrill of being part of bigger and more intense battles without the frustration of having a bunch of idiotic followers clogging up your way. While reeking of "sure, you run ahead into danger", it also allows players to feel important and strong when the side characters tell you to run on ahead and take care of the problem.

Another thing that HL2 did so well is eliminate backtracking through levels when you need to get back to an earlier location. Valve smartly places elevators or extra tunnels or something like those to make sure players don't have to trudge through the same spaces and always are seeing something new and important. Episode Two also does a great job repeating the near seamless continuation from one location and level to another. You're never disconnected from your setting, are always on a course to your goal, and feel the progress being made. It's satisfying in a lot of ways. If it wasn't for the little loads that are still scattered throughout levels, I would have no complaints on this count.


It's strange to talk about it last, but Valve has also made some significant improvements to their engine that allow for some really breathtaking moments that involve a lot of physical objects reacting in the right way. Usually when you see structures fall apart, they look blocky and wrong but what they've done in Episode Two is amazing. You'll see the improvements in a couple of places, but I don't want to say when. It's impossible to miss and well worth the surprise.

Any way you look at it, Episode Two stands out, even among the Half-Life series, as something special. It may be shorter than the original, but it's a burly experience packed into roughly six hours or so that offers up all the diversity, level design, and thoughtful gameplay we've known while making sure to propel the story forward and leave us wanting more. I definitely think you should pick up Orange Box for Portal (or HL2 and Episode One if you haven't played them) but if you like the series, you need to play this one. This is the addition Half-Life 2 fans have been waiting for.

Llevo unos 9 años jugando a los juegos de la saga Half-Life y también la de Portal (que no os engañen las horas de steam que tengo, es que los tuve pirata menos el primero que es original XD) y solo puedo decir que son juegos increibles y muy revolucionarios en sus épocas. Sinceramente recomiendo jugar todas las entregas además de esta porque son impresionantes tanto el modo de narrativa que mantienen en todas las entregas y también el gameplay que es insuperable 10/10 XD. Si algún dia fueran a sacar otra entrega a la saga para continuar la historia lo suyo sería que sacaran Half-Life 2  Episode 3 para concluir la historia del Half-Life 2 original y después de eso sacar el mítico Half-Life 3 si decidieran añadir más material a la saga y así expandirla más hallá de lo que el Half-Life 2 original nos pudo contar. Esta es mi opinión sobre la saga en general y la recomiendo a todo buen gamer que se precie y le gusté los buenos juegos que no te tratan como un bebé diciendote lo que debes hacer a cada rato, (como muchos hacen por desgracia). En resumen recomiendo toda la saga Half-Life y Portal que es 10/10 100% Real no fake unas de las mejores sagas que hay.

Ещё одна глава легендарной игровой серии от Valve. Данная серия меня очень впечатлила, а развязка удивила своей внезапностью и недосказанностью, но, пожалуй, жаль только то ,что история не досказана до конца и обрывается на самом интригующем моменте. Раньше я критиковал людей, ждущих продолжение спустя 10 лет, а сейчас и самому хочется узнать, чем же эта история закончится, но увы мы этого не узнаем... Или может узнаём?
В любом случае за эту серию не жалко ни денег ,ни времени. Однозначно рекомендую 10/10.
This game was such an emotional roller coaster with it's ups and downs. It was one of the best that I have played in awhile. I just wish HL3 was comfirmed.. 100/10
